title: Sell Aged Nikka Whisky
metaTitle: Sell Nikka Taketsuru & Aged Blends | 17, 21, 25 Year | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Sell your aged Nikka whisky including Taketsuru 17, 21, 25, and The Nikka 12. We buy discontinued and current age-statement releases.
heroSubhead: Buying Taketsuru 17, 21, 25 and The Nikka 12 Year Old.
introParagraph: Nikka's pure malts and blends are masterpieces of balance. The discontinued 17, 21, and 25 year Taketsuru bottlings are highly coveted.
photoChecklist: Front label showing age statement large and clear
conditionFactors: Label Design: New vs Old label style affects value (Old Label is often preferred)
Box: 21 and 25 year boxes are substantial and valuable
Ceramic Weight: For Tsuru ceramics, we may ask for a weight check to verify fill
Seal: Plastic integrity on screw caps
pricingFactors: Age: 25 Year is the unicorn, 21 Year is the standard gold, 17 Year is the entry collector
Discontinued Lines: The Nikka 12 was replaced by 'The Nikka Tailored', making the 12 valuable
Packaging: Gift sets with glasses or special stoppers
Market Availability: Global shortages of aged stock drive price

faqs.question: Is the new Taketsuru valuable?
faqs.answer: Nikka re-released the NAS Taketsuru (white label). It is good whisky but holds less value than the age statements.

faqs.question: How much for the Samurai bottle?
faqs.answer: Nikka Gold & Gold Samurai is a cool display piece, but the whisky inside is standard blend. Value is moderate.

faqs.question: Do you buy ceramic bottles?
faqs.answer: Yes, specifically the Nikka Tsuru 17 ceramic decanters.

faqs.question: What about Nikka Coffey Malt?
faqs.answer: We buy it, but usually as part of a larger collection or in bulk.

faqs.question: Do you buy Fortune '80?
faqs.answer: Yes, older discontinued blends like Fortune '80 have a niche market.

faqs.question: Is 'The Nikka 12' rare?
faqs.answer: It was discontinued after a short run, so it has become a minor collector item.
